field_edited_text.value:
Comparison of the Harbor Route with the Northern Route



TABLE 6 c. The cold storage plant at 17-19 East Pratt Street. This plant
serves the wholesale produce firms which are clustered in this area.
PROPERTIES WITH IMPROVEMENT ASSESSMENTS OVER The City is now engaged in a program to construct a new whole-
$560,000 HARBOR ROUTE - MYRTLE AVENUE sale market off Pulaski Highway near the eastern City boundary
TO NORTHEAST EXPRESSWAY and with a transfer of many firms to this new market the need
for a cold storage plant in the old market area would seem to be d
Improved largely disappearing.
Address Assessment Remarks d. The canning plant at 2501-2515 Boston Street operated by H. J.
737-741 West Lombard St. -$ 51,700 Vacant Warehouse McGrath Company. While this plant has been at this location
719-725 West Lombard St. 158,500 Hutzler Warehouse for a long period, the newer portions were constructed in 1938 and
726-734 West Pratt St. 130,000 Hutzler Service Building the plant gives a relatively modern and well kept appearance.
604-618 Portland St. 54,300 Zamoiski Warehouse While it is probable that at least a portion of the plant would
519-525 West Pratt St. 50,000 Loft Building have to be taken, this would not be definitely known until pre-
419-425 West Pratt St. 74,000 Vacant Warehouse liminary designs had been worked out. This report has assumed
309-321 West Pratt St. 90,000 Stewart’s Warehouse and John that the entire plant would be acquired.
C. Stalfort & Sons Manufac- To judge between the two routes based upon the large private build-
turing Chemists ings which would have to be acquired is difficult and different individuals
17-19 East Pratt St. 146,100 Baltimore Cold Storage Co. might well reach differing conclusions. It seems fair to say that this
2339-2355 Boston St. 61,700 Baltimore Feed & Grain Co. factor should not be regarded as decisive.
Factory & Warehouse One other comparison can be made, namely, the amount of vacant
2501-2515 Boston St. 271,300 H. J. McGrath Co.—Canners land potentially available for industrial development which would be
4800-4816 Boston St. 56,100 Dr. Pepper Company Plant rendered unavailable by construction of the Expressway. For the North-
1311 South Ponca St. 72,600 B. H. Hubbert & Son— ern Route this figure would be about 30 acres; for the Harbor Route, it
Coppersmith would be none.
57 A
